caption.p: A) The miniPCR thermocycler and blueGel electrophoretic chamber. B) Outdoor use of the miniPCR device. Portability, ease of use, and low toxicity of the reagents allow genetic material amplification outside the laboratory. C) Amplicons of various lengths can be obtained using different sets of primers targeting a sequence encoding the Ebola virus GP protein. D) Temperature cycling scheme used in our PCR protocol.
